str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
Much, many; often.
And, even, also, namely.
To reject after testing (examination), disqualify. From apo and dokimazo; to disapprove, i.e. to repudiate.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
And, even, also, namely.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
And, even, also, namely.
To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.
And, even, also, namely.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
